meanings.definition: Able to recognize or perceive differences
meanings.sent1: She has a discriminating eye for colors, always choosing the perfect shade.
meanings.sent2: The discriminating child could tell the identical twins apart easily.
meanings.sent3: The discriminating cat only ate the tuna from a specific brand.
meanings.sent4: His discriminating taste in music made him a sought-after DJ.
meanings.sent5: The discriminating detective noticed the subtle clues others missed.

meanings.definition: Showing good judgment or taste in choices
meanings.sent1: Her discriminating palate could distinguish the finest wines.
meanings.sent2: The discriminating shopper always found the best deals without sacrificing quality.
meanings.sent3: The discriminating chef refused to compromise on the quality of ingredients.
meanings.sent4: His discriminating eye for art led him to collect valuable pieces.
meanings.sent5: The discriminating movie buff only watched films with high ratings.

meanings.definition: Treating people unfairly based on race, gender, or other factors
meanings.sent1: The discriminating policy led to discrimination against certain groups.
meanings.sent2: She faced discrimination at work due to her discriminating beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The discriminating remarks made by the boss caused tension in the office.
meanings.sent4: His discriminating behavior towards minorities was unacceptable.
meanings.sent5: The discriminating hiring practices resulted in a lack of diversity in the company.
